findings.title: Attackers can drain funds if the pool-token’s supply is lower than the asset’s supply
findings.description: Attackers can steal assets from a pool by exploiting the difference between the pool-token's supply and the asset's supply.

findings.title: Strike Amount Can Be Zero
findings.description: A strike amount can be zero if the Ether (ETH) price is under $1

findings.title: Malicious pool parameters allow minting of zero tokens when liquidity is added
findings.description: An attacker can mint zero tokens when adding liquidity to a pool with malicious parameters.

findings.title: Stealing option assets through the collection of the fees
findings.description: Malicious contract owner can steal option assets by collecting fees

findings.title: Trapping funds in the option contract, preventing liquidity providers from withdrawing
findings.description: Malicious contract owner can trap funds in the option contract, preventing liquidity providers from withdrawing

findings.title: Creating options for free
findings.description: An attacker could steal the pool's assets by creating options without accounting for the assets present in the option contract.

findings.title: Incorrect bookkeeping when adding or removing assets
findings.description: The pool had incorrect bookkeeping when adding or removing assets, which could allow an attacker to steal the pool’s assets.
